X-Created-At.description: Timestamp of when the resource in the response body was created

X-Next-Cursor.description: The cursor value to use for the next page of results

X-Request-Id.description: A request ID provided by the client. If not provided, the server will generate one. Will be reflected in responses.

X-Smallstep-Api-Version.description: API version to use. Will be reflected in responses.

X-Updated-At.description: Timestamp of when the resource in the response body was last updated

accept.description: The content type the client is willing to accept. Also includes API version.
accept.name: Accept

accountSlug.description: slug identifying the device collection account
accountSlug.name: accountSlug

authorityDomainOrID.description: ID or domain of the authority
authorityDomainOrID.name: authorityDomainOrID

instanceID.description: ID of an instance in a collection
instanceID.name: instanceID

pagination.description: Paginate over a list of objects. Example: `?pagination[first]=30&pagination[after]=MTIzNA==`, which after encoding would be `?pagination%5Bfirst%5D=30&pagination%5Bafter%5D=MTIzNA==`
pagination.name: pagination

after.description:
Fetch a page of results other than the first page.
Must be copied from a previously returned X-Next-Cursor header.

first.description:
Limits the number of results returned.
Defaults to 100.

provisionerNameOrID.description: Either the name or UUID of the provisioner
provisionerNameOrID.name: provisionerNameOrID

requestID.description: A request ID provided by the client. If not provided, the server will generate one. Will be reflected in responses.
requestID.name: X-Request-Id

webhookNameOrID.description: Either the name or UUID of the provisioner webhook
webhookNameOrID.name: webhookNameOrID

acmeAttestationProvisioner.description: A [provisioner](https://smallstep.com/docs/step-ca/provisioners/#acme) that enables automation with the [device-attest-01 challenge of the ACME protocol](https://smallstep.com/blog/acme-managed-device-attestation-explained/).

attestationFormats.description: The allowed attestation formats for the device-attest-01 challenge. Valid values are `apple`, `step`, and `tpm`. The apple format is for Apple devices, and adds trust for Apple's CAs. The step format is for non-TPM devices that can issue attestation certificates, such as YubiKey PIV. It adds trust for Yubico's root CA. The tpm format is for TPMs and does not trust any CAs by default.

attestationRoots.description: A trust bundle of root certificates in PEM format that will be used to verify attestation certificates. The default value depends on the value of attestationFormats. If provided, this PEM bundle will override the CA trust established by setting attestationFormats to apple or step. At least one root certificate is required when using the tpm attestationFormat.

forceCN.description: Force one of the SANs to become the Common Name, if a Common Name is not provided.

requireEAB.description: Only ACME clients that have been preconfigured with valid EAB credentials will be able to create an account with this provisioner.

acmeAttestationProvisioner.title: ACME Device Attestation Provisioner

acmeProvisioner.description: A [provisioner](https://smallstep.com/docs/step-ca/provisioners/#acme) that enables automation with the [ACME protocol](https://smallstep.com/docs/step-ca/acme-basics/#acme-challenges).

challenges.description: Which ACME challenge types are allowed.

forceCN.description: Force one of the SANs to become the Common Name, if a Common Name is not provided.

requireEAB.description: Only ACME clients that have been preconfigured with valid EAB credentials will be able to create an account with this provisioner. Must be `true` for all new provisioners.

acmeProvisioner.title: ACME Provisioner

attestationAuthority.description: An attestation authority used with the device-attest-01 ACME challenge to verify a device's hardware identity. This object is experimental and subject to change.

attestorIntermediates.description: The pem-encoded list of intermediate certificates used to build a chain of trust to verify the attestation certificates submitted by devices.

attestorRoots.description: The pem-encoded list of certificates used to verify the attestation certificates submitted by devices.

createdAt.description: Timestamp in RFC3339 format when the attestation authority was created.

id.description: A UUID identifying this attestation authority. Read only.

name.description: The name of the attestation authority.

root.description: The pem-encoded root certificate of this attestation authority. This is generated server-side when the attestation authority is created. This certificate should be used in the `attestationRoots` field of an ACME_ATTESTATION provisioner with the `tpm` format.

slug.description: A short name for this attestation authority. Read only.

attestationAuthority.title: Attestation Authority

authority.description: An X509 authority hosted by Smallstep.

activeRevocation.description: Whether CRL and OCSP are enabled (advanced authorities only).

adminEmails.description: Users that have admin access to manage the authority.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the authority was created.

domain.description: The domain where the authority can be reached.

fingerprint.description: The SHA-256 digest of the authority's root certificate in hex format.

root.description: The root certificate in pem format.

authority.title: Authority

authorityCsr.description: A certificate signing request for an X509 advanced authority with an external root.

csr.description: A certificate sigining request for the authority's intermediate issuer in pem format.

authorityCsr.title: Authority CSR

authorityType.description: One of the available authority types
authorityType.title: Authority Type

certificateField.description: A certificate field that takes a single string value, e.g. Common Name.

certificateFieldList.description: A certificate field that accepts multiple string values, e.g. SANs.

deviceMetadata.description: A value populated from a key in the device's metadata.

displayName.description: A user-friendly name for the collection.

instanceCount.description: The number of instances in the collection.

schemaURI.description: Reference to a schema that all instances in the collection must conform to.

slug.description: A lowercase name identifying the collection.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp in RFC3339 format when the collections was last updated

id.desription: The ID of the instance in the collection.

displayName.description: A friendly name for the device collection account. Also used as the Common Name, if no static SANs are provided.

slug.description: Used as the identifier for the device collection account.

crtFile.description: The filepath where the certificate is to be stored.

duration.description: The certificate lifetime. Parsed as a [Golang duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration).

gid.description: GID of the files where the certificate is stored.

keyFile.description: The filepath where the key is to be stored.

mode.description: Permission bits of the files where the certificate is stored.

rootFile.description: The filepath where the root certificate is to be stored.

uid.description: UID of the files where the certificate is stored.

endpointHook.description: A list of commands to run before and after a certificate is granted.

after.description: List of commands to run after the operation.

before.description: List of commands to run before the operation.

onError.description: List of commands to run when the operation fails.

shell.description: The shell to use to execute the commands.

endpointHook.title: Managed Endpoint Hook

endpointHooks.description: The collection of commands to run when a certificate for a managed endpoint is signed or renewed.
endpointHooks.title: Managed Endpoint Hooks

endpointKeyInfo.description: The attributes of the cryptographic key.

format.description: The format used to encode the private key. For X509 keys the default format is PKCS#8. The classic format is PKCS#1 for RSA keys, SEC 1 for ECDSA keys, and PKCS#8 for ED25519 keys. For SSH keys the default format is always the OPENSSH format. When a hardware module is used to store the keys the default will be a JSON representation of the key, except on Linux where tss2 will be used.

protection.description: Whether to use a hardware module to store the private key for a workload certificate. If set to `NONE` no hardware module will be used. If set to `DEFAULT` a hardware module will only be used with format `TSS2`. `HARDWARE_WITH_FALLBACK` can only be used with the key format `DEFAULT`.

pubFile.description: A CSR or SSH public key to use instead of generating one.

type.description: The key type used. The current DEFAULT type is ECDSA_P256.

endpointKeyInfo.title: Managed Endpoint Key Info

endpointReloadInfo.description: The properties used to reload a service.

method.description: Ways an endpoint can reload a certificate. `AUTOMATIC` means the process is able to detect and reload new certificates automatically. `CUSTOM` means a custom command must be run to trigger the workload to reload the certificates. `SIGNAL` will configure the agent to send a signal to the process in `pidFile`. `DBUS` will use the systemd system bus to issue a `try-reload-or-restart` job for unit specified by `unitName`. `PLATFORM` uses a method specific to the operating system.

pidFile.description: File that holds the pid of the process to signal. Required when method is SIGNAL.

signal.description: The signal to send to a process when a certificate should be reloaded. Required when method is SIGNAL.

unitName.description: The systemd unit name to reload when a certificate should be reloaded. Required when method is DBUS.

endpointReloadInfo.title: Managed Endpoint Reload Info

secret.description: The JWT itself; this value cannot be retrieved after initially generated and should be kept secret

subdomain.description: The new authority will be available at <subdomain>.<team slug>.ca.smallstep.com.

oidcProvisioner.description: A [provisioner](https://smallstep.com/docs/step-ca/provisioners/#oauthoidc-single-sign-on) that is configured to trust and accept an OAuth provider's ID tokens for authentication. By default, the issued certificate will use the subject (sub) claim from the identity token as its subject. The value of the token's email claim is also included as an email SAN in the certificate.

admins.description: The emails of admin users in an OpenID Connect provisioner. These users will not have restrictions in the certificates to sign.

clientID.description: The id used to validate the audience in an OpenID Connect token.

clientSecret.description: The secret used to obtain the OpenID Connect tokens.

domains.description: The domains used to validate the email claim in an OpenID Connect provisioner.

groups.description: The group list used to validate the groups extension in an OpenID Connect token.

listenAddress.description: The callback address used in the OpenID Connect flow.

tenantID.description: The tenant-id used to replace the templatized tenantid value in the OpenID Configuration.

oidcProvisioner.title: OIDC Provisioner

platform.description: A platform with a list of configurations.
platform.title: Platform

posixGroup.description:
A POSIX group represents a group that exists on a host with the given group name and gid.
A managed group will be created or deleted on the host by Smallstep.
Unmanaged groups must already exist on the host.

An SSH Group may have multiple POSIX groups.
An SSH User belonging to the group will be a member of the POSIX group when they access the host.

id.description: A UUID identifying the POSIX group.

managed.description: Whether Smallstep should create and delete the group.

posixGroup.title: POSIX Group

posixUser.description: A POSIX user is the login user on the SSH Host. It will be generated automatically if not supplied by the team's Identity Provider.

gid.description: The numeric group ID of the user.

uid.description: The numeric ID of the user.

username.description: The login name of the user.

posixUser.title: POSIX User

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the provisioner was created in RFC 3339 format. Generated server-side.

id.description: A UUID identifying this provisioner. Generated server-side when the provisioner is created.

provisioner.description: [Provisioners](https://smallstep.com/docs/step-ca/provisioners/) are methods of using the CA to get certificates with different modes of authorization.

examples.decrypterKeyPEM:
-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY -----
  ...
-----END RSA PRIVATE KEY -----
examples.name: My SCEP Provisioner

provisioner.title: Provisioner

provisionerClaims.description: A set of constraints configuring how this provisioner can be used to issue certificates.

allowRenewalAfterExpiry.description: Allow renewals for expired certificates generated by this provisioner.

defaultHostSSHCertDuration.description: The default duration for an SSH host certificate generated by this provisioner. Parsed as a [Golang duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration).

defaultTLSCertDuration.description: The default duration for an x509 certificate generated by this provisioner. Parsed as a [Golang duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration).

defaultUserSSHCertDuration.description: The default duration for an SSH user certificate generated by this provisioner. Parsed as a [Golang duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration).

disableRenewal.description: Disable renewal for all certificates generated by this provisioner.

enableSSHCA.description: Allow this provisioner to be used to generate SSH certificates.

maxHostSSHCertDuration.description: The maximum duration for an SSH host certificate generated by this provisioner. Parsed as a [Golang duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration).

maxTLSCertDuration.description: The maximum duration for an x509 certificate generated by this provisioner. Parsed as a [Golang duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration).

maxUserSSHCertDuration.description: The maximum duration for an SSH user certificate generated by this provisioner. Parsed as a [Golang duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration).

minHostSSHCertDuration.description: The minimum duration for an SSH host certificate generated by this provisioner. Parsed as a [Golang duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration).

minTLSCertDuration.description: The minimum duration for an x509 certificate generated by this provisioner. Parsed as a [Golang duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration).

minUserSSHCertDuration.description: The minimum duration for an SSH user certificate generated by this provisioner. Parsed as a [Golang duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration).

provisionerClaims.title: Provisioner Claims

provisionerOptions.description: Options that apply when issuing certificates with this provisioner.
provisionerOptions.title: Provisioner Options

provisionerWebhook.description: A [webhook](https://smallstep.com/docs/step-ca/webhooks/) to call when a certificate request is being processed.

bearerToken.description: Webhook requests will include an Authorization header with the token. Optional for `EXTERNAL` webhook servers; not allowed with hosted webhook servers. At most one of `bearerToken` and `basicAuth` may be set.

collectionSlug.description: For HOSTED_ATTESTATION webhooks, the collectionSlug is a reference to the collection that holds the devices that may be issued certificates. This collection must already exist. Required for `HOSTED_ATTESTATION` webhook servers; not allowed for `EXTERNAL`.

disableTLSClientAuth.description: The CA will not send a client certificate when requested by the webhook server. Optional for `EXTERNAL` webhook servers; not allowed with hosted webhook servers.

id.description: UUID identifying this webhook. Generated server-side when the webhook is created. Will be sent to the webhook server in every request in the `X-Smallstep-Webhook-ID` header.

kind.description:
The webhook kind indicates how and when it is called.

ENRICHING webhooks are called before rendering the certificate template. They have two functions. First, they must allow the certificate request or it will be aborted. Second, they can return additional data to be referenced in the certificate template. The payload sent to the webhook server varies based on whether an X509 or SSH certificate is to be signed and based on the type of provisioner.

name.description: The name of the webhook. For `ENRICHING` webhooks, the returned data can be referenced in the certificate under the path `.Webhooks.<name>`. Must be unique to the provisioner.

secret.description: The shared secret used to authenticate the payload sent to the webhook server. Generated server-side. This is returned only for `EXTERNAL` webhook servers and only once, at the time of creation.

serverType.description:
An EXTERNAL webhook server is not operated by Smallstep. The caller must use the returned ID and secret to configure the server.

A HOSTED_ATTESTATION webhook server is hosted by Smallstep and must be used with an `ENRICHING` webhook type and an ACME Attestation provisioner. The webhook server will verify the attested permanent identifier exists as the ID of an instance in the configured collection. The data of the instance in the collection will be added to the template data.

url.description: The URL of the webhook server. Required for `EXTERNAL` webhook servers; read-only for hosted webhook servers.

provisionerWebhook.title: Provisioner Webhook

scepProvisioner.description: The [SCEP provisioner](https://smallstep.com/docs/step-ca/provisioners/#scep) grants certificates to clients using the SCEP protocol. This type is currently experimental and subject to change.

autogenerateDecrypter.description: Automatically generate a new RSA decrypter instead of providing one.

decrypterCertificate.description: A pem-encoded certificate for an RSA public key.

decrypterKey.description: The pem-encoded RSA private key, corresponding to the certificate public key.

decrypterKeyPassword.description: The password for the pem-encoded RSA private key, if any.

encryptionAlgorithmIdentifier.description:
The encryption algorithm used for encrypting responses to the SCEP client:
 * `DES_CBC`    - [DES in CBC mode](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc8018.html#appendix-B.2.1) - `1.3.14.3.2.7`
 * `AES_128_CBC` - [AES-128 in CBC mode](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc8018.html#appendix-B.2.5) - `2.16.840.1.101.3.4.1.2`
 * `AES_128_GCM` - [AES-128 in GCM mode](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc5084.html#section-3.2) - `2.16.840.1.101.3.4.1.6`
 * `AES_256_CBC` - [AES-256 in CBC mode](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc3565.html#section-4.1) - `2.16.840.1.101.3.4.1.42`
 * `AES_256_GCM` - [AES-256 in GCM mode](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc5084.html#section-3.2) - `2.16.840.1.101.3.4.1.46`

excludeIntermediate.description: Exclude the intermediate CA certificate in SCEP responses.

forceCN.description: Force one of the SANs to become the Common Name, if a Common Name is not provided.

includeRoot.description: Include the root CA certificate in SCEP responses.

minimumPublicKeyLength.description: The minimum number of bits for RSA public keys accepted in SCEP requests.

scepProvisioner.title: SCEP Provisioner

sshOptions.description: Options that apply when issuing SSH certificates

template.description: A JSON representation of the SSH certificate to be created. [More info](https://smallstep.com/docs/step-ca/templates/#ssh-templates).

templateData.description: A map of data that can be used by the certificate template.

sshOptions.title: Provisioner SSH Options

tag.description:
A key-value pair attached to a host.
Smallstep determines access by comparing host tags to group grants when a user attempts to SSH to a host.

id.description: A UUID identifying this host tag.

name.description: The key for the host tag.

value.description: The value for the host tag.

tag.title: SSH Host Tag

tpm.description: Configuration for a device collection of machines with TPMs.

attestorIntermediates.description: The pem-encoded list of intermediate certificates used to build a chain of trust to verify the attestation certificates submitted by agents. Ignored if the team already has an attestation authority.

attestorRoots.description: The pem-encoded list of certificates used to verify the attestation certificates submitted by agents. Ignored if the team already has an attestation authority. Required if the team does not already have an attestation authority.

forceCN.description: Force one of the SANs to become the Common Name, if a Common Name is not provided.

requireEAB.description: Only ACME clients that have been preconfigured with valid EAB credentials will be able to create an account with this provisioner.

tpm.title: TPM Device Type

user.description: SSH Users are synced from the team's Identity Provider, or from the default Smallstep directory if no external Identity Provider has been configured.

active.description: Whether the user has been deactivated in the team's Identity Provider.

user.title: SSH User

vpnAccount.description: Configuration to connect a device to a VPN.
vpnAccount.title: VPN

wifiAccount.description: Configuration to connect a device to a protected WiFi network.
wifiAccount.title: WiFi

authorityID.description: A UUID identifying the authority to issue certificates for the workload.

displayName.description: A friendly name for the workload. Also used as the Common Name, if no static SANs are provided.

slug.description: Used as the identifier for the workload.

workloadType.description:
The type of workload being deployed.
Possible values are `etcd` `generic` `git` `grafana` `haproxy` `httpd` `kafka` `mysql` `nginx` `nodejs` `postgres` `redis` `tomcat` and `zookeeper`. 
Use `generic` for a basic certificate workload.

workload.description: A workload represents anything that uses a certificate.
workload.title: Workload

x509Issuer.description: A Customized X509 issuer for an authority.

duration.description: The certificate lifetime. Parsed as a [Golang duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration).

x509Issuer.title: X509 Issuer

x509Options.description: Options that apply when issuing x509 certificates.

template.description: A JSON representation of the x509 certificate to be created. [More info](https://smallstep.com/docs/step-ca/templates/#x509-templates).

templateData.description: A map of data that can be used by the certificate template.

x509Options.title: Provisioner X509 Options

x5cProvisioner.description: A [provisioner](https://smallstep.com/docs/step-ca/provisioners/#x5c---x509-certificate) that authenticates a certificate request with an existing x509 certificate.

roots.description: A list of pem-encoded x509 certificates. Any certificate bundle that chains up to any of these roots can be used in a certificate request.

x5cProvisioner.title: X5C Provisioner

mtls.description: Use a client certificate issued by a trusted root to get short-lived bearer tokens with the step CLI.

info.description:
# Getting Started
First you'll need to get an API token from the Team Settings page of your [Smallstep dashboard](https://smallstep.com/app).
 
Then you can try [listing users](/operations/get-ssh-users) for your first API call:
```
set +o history
echo "Authorization: Bearer [your API token]" > api_headers
set -o history
curl -H @api_headers https://gateway.smallstep.com/api/users
```
 
More resources:
* [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/smallstep/terraform-provider-smallstep)
* [Python Client](https://github.com/smallstep/smallstep-python)
info.title: Smallstep API

get.description: Get a page of accounts.
Get an account.

List all your team's attestation authorities. Although each team has at most one attestation authority this endpoint can be used to determine whether your team already has one and what its properties are.

post.description: Create a new attestation authority hosted by Smallstep. Each team may have at most one attestation authority.

201.description: The attestation authority that was created.

delete.description: Delete an attestation authority by ID

204.description: The SSH grant has been deleted.

get.description: Get a single attestation authority by ID.

post.description: Use client certificate authentication to get an API token

get.description: List all of a team's authorities.

post.description: Create a new devops or advanced authority hosted by Smallstep.

Create a new advanced authority hosted by Smallstep with an external root.
Returns a CSR for the authority's intermediate issuer that must be signed and submitted to the `/authorities/:id/root` endpoint before the authority will be able to issue certificates.

201.description: The CSR for the authority's intermediate issuer.

get.description: Get a single authority by ID or domain.
List all provisioners attached to an authority.

200.description: The full list of provisioners attached to the authority.

post.description: Create a new provisioner attached to an authority.

delete.description: Delete a single provisioner by name or ID.

get.description: Get a single provisioner by name or ID.

post.description: Add a webhook to a provisioner.

delete.description: Delete a single provisioner webhook by name or ID.

get.description: Get a single provisioner webhook by name or ID.

post.description:
Finalize creation of a new advanced Authority with external root by submitting the signed certificate for the CSR previously returned from the `/authorities/csr` endpoint.
Also submit the root certificate and a name for the root.
The authority will be ready to issue certificates after this operation completes.

adminEmails.description: Users that will have admin access to manage the authority

id.description: The `id` returned from a previous call to `/authorities/csr`

rootName.description: A name for the external root issuer

rootPEM.description: The root certificate in pem format

get.description: Get a page of certificates.
Get a certificate by serial number.
Paginate over all your team's collections.

delete.description: Permanently delete a collection and all the instances it contains.

get.description: Retrieve collection metadata.

delete.description: Delete an instance from a collection.

get.description: Retrieve an instance that has been saved to a collection.

put.description: Add an instance to a collection or replace an existing instance.

200.description: The instance that was created or updated in the collection.

get.description:
Retrieve an instances's data that has been saved to a collection.
This is equivalent to the get-collection-instance operation except that the instance data is at the top level of the response body.

put.description:
Add an instance to a collection or replace an existing instance.
This is equivalent to the put-collection-instance operation except the instance data is at the top level of the request and response body.

200.description: The data of the instance that was created or updated in the collection.

get.description: Paginate over all instances in a collection.

200.description: A page of instances in a collection.

parameters.description:
Delete all workloads and devices in the collection.
The API will return 422 if the device collection is not empty and the purge flag is not set.
parameters.name: purge

get.description: Get a device collection.

put.description:
Create or update a device collection.
A device collection is a set of devices that you will use with Smallstep.
You should group your devices by type (eg. AWS VMs, Azure VM, on-prem devices, mobile devices, etc.) and by their need for similar workload configurations.
When you create your first device collection, Smallstep will create a few foundational components (CAs, provisioners, and webhooks) for you.

200.description: The new or updated device collection.

get.description: Get a device collection account.

200.description: The account configuration details for a device collection.

put.description:
Create or update an account in a device collection.
A device collection account is always associated with a pre-existing account and device collection.
put.summary: Create or Update Device Collection Account

get.description: Get a workload.

put.description:
Create or update a workload in a device collection.
When you create a workload, you'll provide a workload type and Smallstep will configure sane defaults for that type of workload.
When you create your first workload, Smallstep will create a few foundational components (CAs, provisioners, and webhooks) for you.

201.description: The newly created enrollment token for the device

get.description: List SSH grants.

200.description: The list of all grants for all groups in the team's directory.

post.description: Add an SSH grant to a group.

201.description: The SSH grant that was created.

delete.description: Delete an SSH grant by ID.

get.description: Get an SSH grant by ID.

List the groups that have been synced from your identity provider's directory.
If your team has not configured an external identity provider this will return groups from the default directory managed by Smallstep.
Get an SSH group by ID.
Get a page of SSH hosts.

parameters.description: If unset or set to `true` the results will only include active hosts. If set to `false` the results will include both active and inactive hosts.
parameters.name: active

parameters.description: Filter (non-)bastion hosts. If unset the results will include both bastion and non-bastion hosts. If set to `true` the results will include only bastion hosts and if set to `false` the results will include only non-bastion hosts.
parameters.name: bastion

get.description: Get a single SSH host by ID.

post.description: Add a tag to an SSH host.

201.description: The new SSH Host Tag. If a tag with the same name/value combination already exists it will be reused.

post.description: Unregister an SSH host by ID.

get.description: Get a page of platforms.

put.description: Create a new platform or update an existing platform.

get.description: Paginate over all of your team's SSH host tags.

200.description: A page of SSH host tags.

get.description:
List the users that have been synced from your identity provider's directory.
If your team has not configured an external identity provider this will return users from the default directory managed by Smallstep.
